events.title: Ottoman Rule
events.description: Palestine is part of the Ottoman Empire, with a largely Arab Muslim and Christian population, and a small Jewish community.

events.title: The First Zionist Congress
events.description: The First Zionist Congress is held in Basel, Switzerland, led by Theodor Herzl, calling for the establishment of a Jewish homeland in Palestine.

events.title: The Balfour Declaration
events.description: The British government issues a statement supporting the establishment of a 'national home for the Jewish people' in Palestine.

events.title: The British Mandate for Palestine
events.description: The League of Nations grants Britain administrative control over Palestine.

events.title: The Arab Revolt
events.description: Palestinian Arabs protest British rule and increased Jewish immigration, leading to a violent crackdown by British forces.

events.title: The Peel Commission
events.description: The first partition plan is proposed, suggesting separate Jewish and Arab states, which both sides ultimately reject.

events.title: United Nations Partition Plan
events.description: The UN recommends partitioning Palestine into separate Jewish and Arab states, with Jerusalem as an international zone.

period: Israel’s Establishment and the First Arab-Israeli War (1948-1949)

events.title: Israel Declares Independence
events.description: Israel declares independence on May 14. The zionist rejoice, for their long awaited dream is being fulfilled

events.title: Al-Nakba - The calamity
events.description: While the zionist rejoice of their victory, half of the Arab-Palestinians are forced out of there homes. All the while a great number of others got killed.

events.title: First Arab–Israeli War
events.description: The Arab-Israeli War of 1948 broke out when five Arab nations invaded territory in the former Palestinian mandate immediately following the announcement of the independence of the state of Israel.

events.title: Armistice Agreements
events.description: Armistice agreements are signed, ending the war. Israel controls 78% of Palestine. Jordan annexes the West Bank, and Egypt controls Gaza.

events.title: Suez Crisis
events.description: Israel, Britain, and France invade Egypt after President Nasser nationalizes the Suez Canal. They withdraw under pressure from the US and USSR.

events.title: The Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO)
events.description: The PLO is founded with the goal of establishing an independent Palestinian state.

events.title: Six-Day War
events.description: Israel preemptively attacks Egypt, Jordan, and Syria, capturing the West Bank, Gaza, East Jerusalem, the Golan Heights, and the Sinai Peninsula.

events.title: UN Resolution 242
events.description: The UN calls for Israel to withdraw from occupied territories in exchange for peace.

events.title: Camp David Accords
events.description: Egypt and Israel sign a peace treaty, returning the Sinai Peninsula to Egypt.

events.title: The First Intifada
events.description: Palestinians protest Israeli occupation, leading to widespread unrest and a harsh Israeli response.

period: Oslo Accords and Attempts at Peace (1990s)

events.title: The Oslo Accords
events.description: Israel and the PLO recognize each other, establishing the Palestinian Authority to govern parts of the West Bank and Gaza.

events.title: Oslo II Accords
events.description: A second agreement expands Palestinian self-rule but divides the West Bank into three areas of control.

period: The Second Intifada and Gaza Disengagement (2000s)

events.title: The Second Intifada
events.description: The Second Intifada erupts after failed peace talks, leading to widespread violence and heavy casualties. Isreali casualties: 1074, Palestinian casualties: 3574.

events.title: Gaza Disengagement
events.description: Israel withdraws settlers and military from Gaza but maintains control over its borders, airspace, and sea.

events.title: Hamas Wins Palestinian Legislative Elections
events.description: Leading to political division between Fatah (West Bank) and Hamas (Gaza).

events.title: Gaza-Israel Conflicts
events.description: Periodic escalations lead to wars, heavy casualties, and significant damage in Gaza.

events.title: Abraham Accords
events.description: Israel normalizes relations with the UAE, Bahrain, and Morocco, brokered by the U.S., without addressing the Israel-Palestine conflict.

events.title: May Conflict
events.description: Tensions over East Jerusalem and Al-Aqsa Mosque spark violence, resulting in an 11-day conflict with high casualties in Gaza.

events.title: West Bank Settlements
events.description: Israel continues settlement expansions in the West Bank, heightening tensions over the two-state solution's viability.
